main event: An object resembling a large meteor or possible satellite was observed descending and disappearing in the distance near San Angelo, Texas.
interesting points: The object appeared rounded and was described as the size of a quarter with a fiery color,It had a long tail and resembled a blinking lantern during its descent,The sighting lasted about 2 seconds with no sound,The flight path of the object was in the form of an arc,The observer was a military pilot with the rank of Captain and was considered very reliable.
sighted object: rounded object with a long tail, resembling a meteor
location: 39 Mi SW of San Angelo, Texas
witness description: military pilot, Captain L. W. Swaners, Flight Commander
